alert.note: Alert for Kent; New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 10 at 6:30PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong line of showers will impact portions of southwestern New Castle, Kent, northeastern Talbot, eastern Queen Anne`s, northern Caroline and northeastern Kent Counties through 700 PM EST... At 628 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking heavy showers and perhaps some embedded thunder along a line extending from near Cecilton to Skipton. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dover, Middletown, Smyrna, Camden, Clayton, Greensboro, Oakland, Delaware City, Ridgely, Cheswold, Millington, Sudlersville, Bowers, Goldsboro, Queen Anne, Woodside, Viola, Hartly, Starr, and Hazlettville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these showers and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
